alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 1:16AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Bath and Fleming. * WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 115 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Owingsville, Sharpsburg, Pebble, Odessa, Oakley, Wyoming, Sherburne, Slate Valley, Grange City, Craigs, Reynoldsville, Tilton, Hillsboro, Peasticks, Bethel, Pecks Ridge, Bourbon Furnace and Ringos Mills.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
